loremaster: ^You smell him first, on the wind. Human smells. Sweat. Smoke. Fat. Rancid.

loremaster_approach: ^Footsteps, clumsy on rock and sand. Horrible ungainly creature. Closer, closer, come into the water.
^But the song is done. Your voice is gone. And he stops when the surf washes over his boots. Looks at you. then away.
loremaster_reflects: ^"It's all beautiful, isn't it? Our home. Our people."
siren_stares: ^The hunger claws at your own belly. The crabs and silver fishes sustain you, but it's never enough. The hole inside is always there. Seeing him makes it deepen.
^Come into the water. Come into the water. Come into the water.
loremaster_beauty: ^"Well, perhaps not everything can be beautiful. But the town is flourishing now. Thanks to you. To me."
loremaster_bashful: ^"Now now, don't be bashful." A pause.
loremaster_praise: ^"I mean it. Truly, I do. This is our doing. Without you, our people would have starved. Our homes would have collapsed. And without me, well...

c-1: ^"And without her too, of course. You're absolutely correct. Ultimately it's all her doing. But let's
g-0: ^just say the future looks bright now. The old ways are best way forward."

siren_lore_teeth: ^His blood would be hot and red, like a porpoise. Sickly, though, like the other ones who come when you call.
lorekeeper_enthused: ^"Yes! Exactly! The outsiders' blood will water our lands and their machines refresh the bones of our town."
siren_lore_away: ^A new scent on the night wind. Warm. Clean. Familiar. And then gone.
loremaster_bones: ^"You know it's true. You must feel it in your bones now."

loremaster_song: ^You feel it welling back up from deep within you. Opening your mouth, the song pours forth.

siren_sated_lore: ^The colour drains from his face and into your hands, filling you with a deep satisfaction. He turns and runs, stumbling in his haste to escape.
^You ignore him, and take your new prize home to admire.
